revised_title: Oblique Reflection of Very Long Wireless Waves from the Ionosphere: A Theoretical Analysis
tldr: The authors present a theoretical analysis of the oblique reflection of very long wireless waves from the ionosphere. They divide the ionosphere into a transition region and a reflecting region and provide a solution for the case of oblique incidence, which is valid for very long waves. The study aims to provide a more satisfactory basis for the theoretical interpretation of measurements made at short and medium distances from a very long wave transmitter.
